com.equinox

Class Memory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.equinox.Memory

  • public class Memory
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores all Todos and keeps state information allowing Undo and Redo operations. Maximum number of states that can be stored by Memory is .
    Author:
    Ho Wei Li || IkarusWill

      Memory()
      Constructs an empty Memory object.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Todo todo)
        Adds the specified Todo to memory. The current state is saved prior to any operation.
        Parameters:
        todo - the Todo to be added.

      • get

        public Todo get(int id)
         throws com.equinox.exceptions.NullTodoException
        Retrieves the Todo identified by the specified ID from the memory.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the Todo to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the Todo object identified by the specified ID.
        Throws:
        com.equinox.exceptions.NullTodoException - if the Todo identified by the specified ID does not exist.

      • setterGet

        public Todo setterGet(int id)
               throws com.equinox.exceptions.NullTodoException
        Retrieves the Todo identified by the specified ID from the memory for editing. The current state is saved prior to any operation.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the Todo to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the Todo object identified by the specified ID.
        Throws:
        com.equinox.exceptions.NullTodoException - if the Todo identified by the specified ID does not exist.

      • remove

        public Todo remove(int id)
            throws com.equinox.exceptions.NullTodoException
        Removes the Todo identified by the specified id from the memory. The current state is saved prior to any operation.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the Todo to be removed.
        Throws:
        com.equinox.exceptions.NullTodoException - if the Todo identified by the specified ID does not exist.

      • restoreHistoryState

        public void restoreHistoryState()
                         throws com.equinox.exceptions.StateUndefinedException
        Restores the latest history state of the memory. Also known as the undo operation.
        Throws:
        com.equinox.exceptions.StateUndefinedException - if there are no history states to restore to.

      • restoreFutureState

        public void restoreFutureState()
                        throws com.equinox.exceptions.StateUndefinedException
        Restores the latest future state of the memory. Also known as the redo operation.
        Throws:
        com.equinox.exceptions.StateUndefinedException - if there are no future states to restore to.

      • getAllTodos

        public java.util.Collection<Todo> getAllTodos()
        Method to get all the Todos for displaying purposes.
        Returns:
        all Todos as Collection

      • obtainFreshId

        public int obtainFreshId()
        Obtains an ID number from the pool of available ID numbers.
        Returns:
        the ID obtained.

      • releaseId

        public void releaseId(int id)
        Releases the specified ID number to the pool of available ID numbers for future use by new Todos.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID to be released.

        Returns:
